channel.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
channel.description:
Hey Mopar,
I'm Dylan. I'm from B.C., Canada. My past history of Runescape dates back to around 2005 (give or take a year.) [in other words, the birth of runescape classic.] But this topic isn't about you guys getting to know me.
I have this urge to learn how to code, manage, and run a server. I have the drive to take however long it usually takes to learn it, or even longer. With summer coming up, I really REALLY want something to do over the summer that is educational. Yes, I want to learn this for EDUCATIONAL use. I'm 15, and all of my teachers say that I'm a pretty smart kid, and that when I put my head to something, I can do it. If I learn to do what I want to do, I'd say I can become a [b]pretty nice asset to this community.[/b] I can see that this forum (this section, in paticular) is quite against newcomers learning (or, in other words, ctrl+ving) how to make a server. I've read almost every post in the forum, and what I've learned so far is this: packets are literally bags of information that are sent from the client to the server, such as when someone drops an item, attacks a monster, turns on a prayer, etc...environmental tables are paths that your computer recognizes, as in if you add your whole location of your "compile.bat" to the path list, then it will recognize it as "...wholepath/compile.bat".
I'm guessing I've learned around 0.5% of what I have to. Somethings that I've read about that I still don't understand are MySQL databases, Hamachi (sounds like a pokemon), and Apache ANT. Also learning to code Java might be helpful.
So, if you're willing to take me under your wing, private message me and we can swap MSN's or something. I'm sure you guys know what you're doing better than I do.
Thanks so much, Dylan

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I don’t think he needs 3 different people telling him that he’s mixed up his years.

Anyway, to be completely honest with you, most people simply don’t have the time to give a person sufficient one-on-one help.
People don’t mind for small things (eg, frank_ has given me loads of help with various things over time), but it’s not going to happen when you’re just a beginner. The reason for this isn’t because you’re seen as useless but simply because there are already plenty of resources on the web aimed at beginners.
You’re better off picking up what you can from these other resources and making a bit of a name for yourself. If you manage that then I see no reason why people wouldn’t be happy to answer your questions on more RSC-specific programming related subjects (ie, client protocol and so on).

As for resources, http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/ is a personal favourite.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

RSC was released somewhere around 2000 - 2001. RS (2), however, was released somewhere between the begining and the middle of 2004.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

RSC is way older then 2005.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @F1sh3r F1sh3r
item.description:
@F1sh3r wrote:

Well, then I was extremely off on my years, now wasn’t I. The first character I ever made on RSC was “Xatain”. Look him up.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @zraffz zraffz
item.description:
@zraffz wrote:

[quote=“F1sh3r, post:1, topic:210264”]Hey Mopar,

I’m Dylan. I’m from B.C., Canada. My past history of Runescape dates back to around 2005 (give or take a year.) [in other words, the birth of runescape classic.] But this topic isn’t about you guys getting to know me.[/quote]
liar… RSC came out way before 2005…
you mean rs2 fruitcup.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

[quote=“F1sh3r, post:5, topic:210264”]I love your optomistic attitude.

If anyone is willing, just PM me. I’ll be here.

EDIT: Thanks, I’ll be sure to read it thoroughly.[/quote]im actually making my own divinepk installation where java/apacheant is preinstalled and its a lot easier. i tried it on 3 computers. ill upload it either today or tommorrow (most likely tommorrow), and pm you the link.
its 430mb uncompressed, and like ~100mb compressed. its very easy to install imo.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @F1sh3r F1sh3r
item.description:
@F1sh3r wrote:

I love your optomistic attitude.

If anyone is willing, just PM me. I’ll be here.

EDIT: Thanks, I’ll be sure to read it thoroughly.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

i have seen tones of people feeling cocky, like they can do this, they get 1/3 of the way setting up demonik/divinepk and say “fuck it, this is too hard for me”. and idk if anyone will help you, this topic will most likely get locked.
id recommend searching on google for how to set divinepk up, and go from there. but after you set it up, you should learn java before you try to code.
found a link to dpk. http://www.speedyshare.com/973570745.html
there is a readme in it that says how to set it up. gl.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @F1sh3r F1sh3r
item.description:
@F1sh3r wrote:

I don’t think so. Like I said, I have a high drive to do this.
I just need someone to help me…start up. I’d say it’s like starting a grade 12 French class with only the text book. You can only get so much information out of it before becoming confusing.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Server Development Trainee
item.dc:creator: @i_pk_pjers_i i_pk_pjers_i
item.description:
@i_pk_pjers_i wrote:

dont get your hopes up, most likely you’ll give up.
and you dont need hamachi if you get a dedi or port forward.
also: youve learned a lot more than complete “noobs” that are like “OMG LYK I NEED SUM JAVA COKDES FER MI SERVER SO I KAN HAV TA BEST SERVER YA SO I KAN INSERT DEM AND I WILL BE PWN!!!”

Read full topic
